paragraphs.text:
%md # Introduction to Developer Training, Part II This curriculum is recommended for query writers, ETL processors, and developers who have completed Part 1 of our Developer training and want to proceed on to more advanced topics. To understand the topics in this section, you need to have experience with SQL. For some notebooks some familiarity with Python or Scala is recommended. You can expect to spend 2-3 hours completing this curriculum. Note that each notebook contains a link to the next notebook in the sequence, and most notebooks also contain links to related pages in our Splice Machine Documentation web. This is the sequence of notebooks in our *Splice Machine Advanced Developer's* class:
 1. If you've not already done so, please complete our Developer's Guide - Part 1 training class.
 2. The Running the TPCH-1 Benchmark Queries notebook introduces you to importing TPCH-1 benchmark data into your database and then creating indexes, compacting your database, collecting statistics, and running the TPCH-1 queries.
 3. The Common Utilities notebook describes a number of utilities that you may find useful when working with Splice Machine.
 4. The The Life of a Query notebook is a more in-depth walk-through of creating, populating, and querying TPCH benchmark data in Splice Machine.
 5. The Visualizing Results with Zeppelin notebook shows you how to use Zeppelin for filtering and graphing query results.
 6. The Transactions with Spark and JDBC notebook provides a glimpse into the transactional nature of Splice Machine and introduces use of the %spark interpreter with a JDBC connection.
 7. The Creating Applications with Splice Machine notebook shows you how to run a Spring application (the Petclinic web app) with Splice Machine.
 8. The Using the Splice Machine Native Spark DataSource notebook demonstrates how our Native Spark DataSource allows you to adopt the full power of Spark and manipulate dataframes while also having the power of full ANSI, ACID-compliant SQL.
 9. The Machine Learning with Spark MLib using Python notebook contains Python code that uses the Machine Learning Library embedded in Spark, MLlib, with the Splice Machine Spark Adapter to realize in-process machine learning.
10. The Creating Custom Stored Procedures notebook show you how to create and deploy custom, stored functions and procedures that you can call from your SQL queries in Splice Machine .
11. The ETL Pipeline notebook presents a simple example of constructing an ETL pipeline with Splice Machine.

msg.data:
Introduction to Developer Training, Part II

This curriculum is recommended for query writers, ETL processors, and developers who have completed Part 1 of our Developer training and want to proceed on to more advanced topics. To understand the topics in this section, you need to have experience with SQL. For some notebooks some familiarity with Python or Scala is recommended. You can expect to spend 2-3 hours completing this curriculum.

Note that each notebook contains a link to the next notebook in the sequence, and most notebooks also contain links to related pages in our Splice Machine Documentation web.

This is the sequence of notebooks in our Splice Machine Advanced Developer’s class:

 1. If you've not already done so, please complete our Developer's Guide - Part 1 training class.
 2. The Running the TPCH-1 Benchmark Queries notebook introduces you to importing TPCH-1 benchmark data into your database and then creating indexes, compacting your database, collecting statistics, and running the TPCH-1 queries.
 3. The Common Utilities notebook describes a number of utilities that you may find useful when working with Splice Machine.
 4. The The Life of a Query notebook is a more in-depth walk-through of creating, populating, and querying TPCH benchmark data in Splice Machine.
 5. The Visualizing Results with Zeppelin notebook shows you how to use Zeppelin for filtering and graphing query results.
 6. The Transactions with Spark and JDBC notebook provides a glimpse into the transactional nature of Splice Machine and introduces use of the %spark interpreter with a JDBC connection.
 7. The Creating Applications with Splice Machine notebook shows you how to run a Spring application (the Petclinic web app) with Splice Machine.
 8. The Using the Splice Machine Native Spark DataSource notebook demonstrates how our Native Spark DataSource allows you to adopt the full power of Spark and manipulate dataframes while also having the power of full ANSI, ACID-compliant SQL.
 9. The Machine Learning with Spark MLib using Python notebook contains Python code that uses the Machine Learning Library embedded in Spark, MLlib, with the Splice Machine Spark Adapter to realize in-process machine learning.
10. The Creating Custom Stored Procedures notebook show you how to create and deploy custom, stored functions and procedures that you can call from your SQL queries in Splice Machine .
11. The ETL Pipeline notebook presents a simple example of constructing an ETL pipeline with Splice Machine.

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Where to Go Next
Please start this class the [*Running the TPCH-1 Benchmark Queries*](/#/notebook/2DW2MCTTP) notebook to learn about creating indexes, compacting your database, collecting statistics, and running advanced queries.
